intro: Heracleum minimum, commonly known as small cow parsnip, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring a hollow, ridged stem and large, pinnately lobed leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in compound umbels, and it produces small, hairy fruits called schizocarps. The plant is often found in moist meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils.
